Articles.Content:
Hello my friendly KSPers.

I find myself at a bit of an inpass, and any help would be appriciated: I'm playing career mode and finally managed to unlock the science lab, obviously  my first thought was to launch one into orbit and start milking that sweet, sweet science. However to my dismay upon arriving on orbit I found I was unable to transmit any data to the science lab, whenever I performed an experiment and clicked the button to send it to the lab an orange text comes up saying "experiment media removed" and no data gets transfered. 

I have been playing around with it trying diferent experiments but none seem to do the trick, can anyone please point me in the right direction as to how to fix this? 

Thanks in advance.

Mel.

Hello @Melencar, welcome to the forums

I'm not sure what that message is, and since obody else replied, it looks like others feel the same. Maybe you could document your issue in screenshots, and try the technical support subforum instead?

On 24/09/2016 at 6:43 AM, Melencar said:

I found I was unable to transmit any data to the science lab

You are talking about the "transmit" button in the experiment result dialog no? IIRC, it only transmits back to kerbin (and if it is a non-reusable, scientist required for reset experiment, generates the "experiment media removed" message). The science "transmit" value is added to your science "score", not to the lab.

You can get data into the lab in 2 ways:
If your experiment is attached to the lab, you should have an additional "process in lab" (flask icon) button in the experiment result/review data dialog. Processing will add to the labs "data" quota, which can then be used for research.
After you have processed the data, you can also do the usual things with it (like transmit it), for even more juicy science.  
If your experiment is not attached to the lab, you will have to take the data from the experiment with a kerbal on EVA (right-click -> "take data"), then put it in the lab, either from EVA (right-click -> "store data") or by boarding the lab. Then use the "review data" dialog on the lab as described above.

Edited September 27, 2016 by steve_v
